reviews.text:
This zoo is a wonderful place for a visit! It is small enough that you could probably make it through in about a two hours if you needed to, but could definitely spend several hours of you wanted. 

Price for going to the zoo is very reasonable. The food price inside is very expensive. 

There is a good variety of animals, and I have seen a lot of animal movements unlike other zoos where the animals just nap all the time. The cat walk is my favorite part. My son loves the reptile building. 

Some of the animals are put away during the winter but the zoo is still open and delightfully quiet compared to Saturdays in the summer. 

I highly recommend this for a stop if you are from out of town. If you live in town, get a membership cause this is a great place to go multiple times.

I have been to Zoos all over the country and I love the Albuquerque Bio Park. There is a lot to do here and the animals have lots of space. It will take a full day to walk through and see everything. They are always doing some updates and improving the habitats. They have one of the most amazing and largest collections of reptiles. This bio park also has a large plant collection. There is a lot of educational resources as well.  You will love this zoo.

Best zoo I have ever been to.  Up close and personal to most exhibits.  Clean, affordable, and we bought a membership and have able to enjoy all the attractions several times.
Take the train to learn as much as you can about the zoo.
We ate lunch in the cafe and it was great.  
Highly recommend this zoo.

Decided it was a beautiful day to go to the zoo
.Checking out all the animals we missed the Hippo feeding, which happens at 2:30. This is a must see, it's amazing to see in person just how wide their mouths open.
Spoke with two different zoo keepers and was very knowledgeable and pleasant.

Disappointed in the lack of stands open since it was so busy...but nevertheless we enjoyed the time.
Animals were out and most active, loved the new play area.

Love our little zoo! It's quaint, intimate and nicely laid out.  The animals are well taken care of.  The train is awesome, especially for the little ones.  Has a great play area as well.  Nice concession stand.  They have amazing special events as well, like zoo boo, live music and even an overnight stay!

This zoo is a wonderful place for a visit! It is small enough that you could probably make it through in about a two hours if you needed to, but could definitely spend several hours of you wanted. 

Price for going to the zoo is very reasonable. The food price inside is very expensive. 

There is a good variety of animals, and I have seen a lot of animal movements unlike other zoos where the animals just nap all the time. The cat walk is my favorite part. My son loves the reptile building. 

Some of the animals are put away during the winter but the zoo is still open and delightfully quiet compared to Saturdays in the summer. 

I highly recommend this for a stop if you are from out of town. If you live in town, get a membership cause this is a great place to go multiple times.

I have been to Zoos all over the country and I love the Albuquerque Bio Park. There is a lot to do here and the animals have lots of space. It will take a full day to walk through and see everything. They are always doing some updates and improving the habitats. They have one of the most amazing and largest collections of reptiles. This bio park also has a large plant collection. There is a lot of educational resources as well.  You will love this zoo.

Best zoo I have ever been to.  Up close and personal to most exhibits.  Clean, affordable, and we bought a membership and have able to enjoy all the attractions several times.
Take the train to learn as much as you can about the zoo.
We ate lunch in the cafe and it was great.  
Highly recommend this zoo.

Decided it was a beautiful day to go to the zoo
.Checking out all the animals we missed the Hippo feeding, which happens at 2:30. This is a must see, it's amazing to see in person just how wide their mouths open.
Spoke with two different zoo keepers and was very knowledgeable and pleasant.

Disappointed in the lack of stands open since it was so busy...but nevertheless we enjoyed the time.
Animals were out and most active, loved the new play area.

Love our little zoo! It's quaint, intimate and nicely laid out.  The animals are well taken care of.  The train is awesome, especially for the little ones.  Has a great play area as well.  Nice concession stand.  They have amazing special events as well, like zoo boo, live music and even an overnight stay!

A nice memorable stroll through the different regions of waters. A very nice modern design with resting/viewing seats along the way. Lots of education and conservation tips along the way. There's a spacious cafe for b4 or after your aquarium walk...AND about half of the seats view the large primary tank! I didn't look to see if "fish" was a menu option. If it's feeding time, the keepers were willing to chat it up.☺

The aquarium was absolutely incredible! So many different fish of all sizes including Seahorses and Stingrays.  Tons of turtles and some beautiful sharks. The bug exhibit was so amazing to see as well. How the colonies work together is able to be seen on display across the entire big area.

You definitely need a whole day to see everything. I arrived before noon but still completely missed the Botanical Garden. The aquarium is small but very beautiful. The zoo has an interesting layout and you will need a map to plan out your approach so you can go back to the train on time. 

We loved the opportunity to have lunch by a massive aquarium with sharks and turtles and other beautiful creatures swimming behind us

I love the biopark. It's a good place to visit for everyone. besides the aquarium, the gardens are a wonderful place to spend time outdoors no matter the season. Lots of places and spaces to rest or have a picnic, and During the warmer months many beautiful species of plants and animals can be seen. Definitely visits the Japanese gardens too! I love bringing bird food to the gardens and feed the ducks and geese, my kids love it!

When traveling we always tour the local Aquarium as I have been a hobbyist since I was seven! 🐟🐠🐡It is well laid out with amazing displays, we loved the walk through reef tank and the 🦈 tank. 
One otter was out relaxing on a floating platform. We finished out tour with a nice glass of St. Claire wine sitting right beside the shark tank in the Reef restaurant. Thanks to the City of Albuquerque and all the staff supporting this amazing place. We will be back. 👍

Great place to spend a few hours with a lot of balloon history to learn about. Gift shop is a must with many unique items to get. Every one of the staff I have met was super friendly with much information to share. Met Jill in the gift shop and learned so much. To bad Jack (dog) wasn't there (:. Atmosphere is one of the best I've experienced.

I actually really enjoyed the museum way more than I thought and it is truly a incredibly well done museum. The installations are high quality and there's a good mix of interactivity. I would say my biggest drawback was the lack of docents. Felt a little too self guided and I had questions with no one to ask. But still totally go because it's a weird and fun thing with a lot of unique history and weather facts!

We came here for the early morning Balloons & Breakfast event during the Albuquerque Balloon Fiesta. Coming in the early morning was great because you get to see a combo glow and mass ascension. Not only is the view stunning with the balloons close enough you feel as if you could touch them you get to be in a cozy glass enclosed room with a wonderful buffet and warm drinks. We were originally suppose to be down on the field but went to purchase our tickets too late and decided to spend the extra money to go to the museum event. It was the best decision we made! I would highly recommend going to a museum event. Everything was wonderful - the food, atmosphere, balloon view, hospitality, parking and the museum exhibit!

If you are interested in hot air ballooning, this is THE place to go.  Absolutely fascinating.  There is no restaurant or snack bar, and you can't eat anything inside the museum.  Go anyway.  You won't regret it.

The balloon museum is always a great place to be, especially when we have our annual international hot air balloon fiesta (the First Saturday into the next 6 days and nights). If you ever come our way from out of state be sure to book your hotel room and rented vehicle about 8-10 weeks in advance. Dress appropriately as some seasons it’s cold and others warm like summer.
Always have enjoyed their exhibitions. We have eaten at the restaurant and like their food and service
Saw the chola exhibit here. What an amazing world class facility.
Very clean Sàlon Ortega! Spacious and acoustically sound. Traditional NM architecture. Love the vigas. Bsthroom was dirty with water in floor of stalls.

I came here with a friend's family to see the piñata exhibit earlier this year. It was great and we all loved it. I was limited in my exploration of the museum because of the kids but I made a note to come back. Looks better than I expected.

I am a teacher and our community, Valle Vista Elementary,  are neighbors with NHCC. I cannot express adequately, in words,  how fortunate we are to have them so close. They offer opportunities for our young learners for free and it is greatly appreciated...Thank you NCHH for having a nurturing voice in our community.

Lovely visit to the Sandia Peaks Tram even on a snowy, cloudy day. The way up was the very exciting. We had the best driver/operator! Came a few weeks ago and the views were amazing. Staff is super nice and helpful. The gentleman in the gift shop seemed to really enjoy his job!

Really fun thing to go do. I went and bought a ski ticket and a tram ticket, and skied half a day. They have a good deal for that. It's fast than driving all the around the mountain to get to Sandia ski. The person running the tram gives fun facts too! Also, get there +30 min if you want to take the tram to ski.

This is a recommended attraction and we can see why. We got the early and we're one of the first ones up. The views were spectacular! There is a guide in the team who have very interesting commentary on the way up and down. The one thing they could have warned us about is that there was still lots of snow on the ground so no real hiking for us at the top.

Pretty fun experience! Staff was friendly & the place was really clean. Spectacular views going up and coming down. Stood on the left side going up & the left side going down so I saw both sides excellent. Definitely worth the $25... if you’re passing by, I highly recommend stopping by.

It’s beautiful at night. You can see all of Albuquerque glowing! Definitely bring water and snacks before me going. The closest restroom is quite the drive away.
I’m definitely going to be coming back again and again.
Such a fun and beautiful museum! Great exhibits, and so much art work! Plus free parking, which I'm always grateful to have. It's a wonderful sampling of New Mexico history, art, and culture.

The Albuquerque Museum is a must see in Albuquerque for tourists and locals alike. They have world class exhibits and a newly renovated permanent vacation. The staff is super helpful and informative. They have free days for local New Mexicans. A great place for culture and beautiful artwork.

If you are learning about the history and diverse and rich cultures of New Mexico and Albuquerque, this is the place to come and explore. They have many permanent exhibits as well as a special rotating exhibition. Artifacts, pictures and stories gathered from around the area and how the town came to be and prosper as well as its distinctive flavor of vibrant life. There is a gift shop and cafe in the museum as well.

Such a beautiful museum! I really enjoyed my most recent visit, especially the "Visions of the Hispanic World" exhibit, it is well worth the extra cost. There were so many amazing pieces, and the history is very fascinating. I also loved to see the collection of pieces that were created by New Mexican artists. This is an excellent museum!
Always enjoy coming here and bringing visitors.  I always learn something new about our city and state.  Even the security guards are helpful and knowledgeable.

Our whole family loves Explora. We go all the time. We are member's, it's the best way to go. You get discounts on the gift shop and you get to explore all day. My kids love the bubble room and the water area the most. I highly recommend you taking the whole family. It's fun and educational.

We had toddlers and this was a great place for them to explore. I'd guess the best ages would be 11 and under, but we adults had a great time too. We found a lot to interact with and learn from. A great family outing!
Our four kids ages 2 to 8 had a blast here. We were able to get in free with our membership to our local museum thanks to a great reciprocity program, but we would’ve paid if that wasn’t the case.
This is definitely a place to bring children to and adults can enjoy themselves as well. You’re going to enjoy the elevator! Five stars.

This is a favorite of ours when my family makes our 4x a year trips to New Mexico. It's aging a little, but still a super fun place for the kiddos. Make sure you ask if they partner with your local children's museum to offer reduced costs.

I was extremely impressed at the enormous collection and display of Turquoise from around the world.  It was interesting and educational.  I would recommend anyone with a bit of curiosity regarding turquoise and the Native American visit this Museum.
Just opened.  Nice turquoise collection loose and in jewelry and out as samples.
Fabulous, educational, family friendly.

I really enjoyed my tour; I think it's a very good value. The host is extremely knowledgeable and not overbearing. I liked being shown around first and then being allowed to wander and read through the info on my own. I don't have that strong of an interest in turquoise, yet I still felt that the info as presented was edifying, enlightening, and worthwhile, as well as germane. I was visiting ABQ from out of state and feel that I learned pertinent info in a unique way. Thank you!
Absolutely awesome place

I think this is a great place for kids who have a scientific bent towards astronomy or the natural sciences in general. I came here when I was a kid and loved it. The collection is great. However, there is no getting around the fact that you will most likely need a scientific bent, or an interest in rocks, astronomy, etc. to appreciate this place. Have fun!
A very small but nice museum.
Great introduction to a specialized topic. Interesting display of rock and iron meteorites. Not a place to bring young kids... its just a large room on a college campus. Worth a stop at least once.
Nice view.

Not as good as it used to be 4 years ago. I was looking forward to coming back and trying it again. I thought maybe it was just me but after reading other comments I know its not just me. Flavor is gone, mediocre food. Very little meat in my regular burrito which for me is just fine but there was also even less green chili. Great friendly service though.

My fiance and Father in law have been going here for years. Today was my first time and I loved it.
I ordered Huevos Rancheros with red Chile. Yummy yummy.
It was a trip for us but well worth it. I recommend adding this location to your "must stop" places.

These are the best new Mexican burritos around. You can't go wrong here. Try one of the meat or bean before going for the giant burrito thing. The giant one is good but you need to try the regular burritos to really know how good they are.
I think Albuquerque was built around this place. It has been here as long as I can remember. It serves a local version of Mexican fast food, which has always tasted great.
The food is good and the price is also good the service is quick  the location is not the best. It is if you work or live on military base. Even if you live in the hood.

Durans is a very unique place to visit aside from getting my prescriptions filled. They have the most amazing things from local jewelry that is beautiful and priced well to the most unique socks to handbags to very unique greeting cards. They have wonderful candy too. Just place a visit to Durans you will not be sorry the restaurant is also very good. customer service is also very friendly staff.

The pharmacy also has several aisles where you can get everyday items. The store is clean and the staff was polite. There is also a restaurant located on the premises. The food is excellent! Two words: Red chile

I used to love this restaurant but after the experience I had. I will not go back. The bathrooms stunk and were dirty. Food had hair in it twice. Service was worse. I even asked for my food with an extra corn tortilla and the waitress response was oh we’re to busy tho cooks won’t make it when we’re busy. I’m paying to eat here. Ridiculous
I love this place so much. The food is good and the people are so lovely and attentive. This is an ABQ staple and the employees are really what add to the experience.
Service is top of the line, management was spectacular, the food...... The best beans and potatoes I've ever had; homemade taste to perfection. Fresh tortillas...  Deserves more than a 5 🌟..

Los Cuates is a decently good restaurant. If you're looking for traditional New Mexican food this is NOT the restaurant to visit. Their food is slightly different then normal New Mexican food. They're red salsa is unique, very good, but different. From what I understand it has unique secret ingredients including chocolate. Their restaurants have a beautiful ambience. Their staff is usually friendly. Service has been a hit-or-miss in time.  I haven't gone to this restaurant in awhile.   Something about it does not call me back.

Some of the worst service I've ever received. They were fast with the chips and salsa but no water or drink order. Asked for some water but none ever came after sitting there  10 minutes. Noticed other tables had nothing to drink either. This is the second time, different location. We left for a different New Mexican restaurant and had excellent service there.

I came to have a late lunch with a friend, Ally was our server. Ally was wonderful she was very attentive to all of her tables. The food came out very quickly and was wonderful.  There seemed to be communication issues between management and servers. Ally picked up about 5 tables in 10-15 minutes when she wasn't aware that she was by herself. Someone needs to make a walk through the dining room and help with refills and such when this happens.  Keep up the great work Ally, I'll definitely ask for you when I come back.
The atmosphere is always welcoming and service is great there. I called for a big family get together at the last minute and they were able to seat us, but do call first. Food was great!

Definitely enjoyed my dining experience tonight and am looking forward to my leftovers! It started with being greeted with a big smile from the hostess Genesis and ended with another smile from her when she told us thank you. The food and portion sizes are both very good! Will be back again soon!
Great New Mexico food with very attentive service. Very clean. Mr. Ortega stopped by to check on our food and chat with us. Staff humored my energetic nephews. Amazing salsa too! Recommended.
Great chimichanga burrito. Good service. Fair prices.

We visited Ortega's for the first time tonight and we were very impressed! The service was fantastic, everyone was so friendly and helpful! Our food came out really fast, and was delicious (best tamale I have had in a while!). We will definitely be returning very soon!
The food was beyond words,  the best way to describe it, is that it felt like I was eating a home cooked meal at my grandmother's house again.  Thank you to the Ortega family for the wonderful  meal.
This is my favorite place to eat and spend time with my family. Every time we have a friend or relative come into town we take them here to try the best food in town. Love you guys!

I'm getting used to these Mom & Pop New Mex joints. Most of them open from--say--7-8AM to 2-3PM, serving hearty breakfasts, and well prepared lunches. This is a local concept that helps to define New Mex cuisine. Not surprisingly, they were packed when we visited, and we had to wait a bit for a table. I was with a couple of tenderfoots, so sauces (red/green) came on the side. Both sauces were amazing.
Amazing food friendly staff! Food tastes like a nice home cooked meal! Will definitely be back next time we are in the area.

I'm getting used to these Mom & Pop New Mex joints. Most of them open from--say--7-8AM to 2-3PM, serving hearty breakfasts, and well prepared lunches. This is a local concept that helps to define New Mex cuisine. Not surprisingly, they were packed when we visited, and we had to wait a bit for a table. I was with a couple of tenderfoots, so sauces (red/green) came on the side. Both sauces were amazing. I did their GCC, and while not the best I've had in New Mexico, it was still a solid sender for Hatch flavor. Their complimentary whole wheat Sopapillas on the other hand were stupid good. They greatly enhanced savory bites, and then squeezes of honey at the end of the meal for a sweet bite. Genuinely friendly folks kept the revolving door of patrons pleased and satisfied. Perea's was a total winner, plain and simple...
Such a great quaint place! Delicious food, but you gotta be able to take the heat and plan to eat and leave. It's tiny and usually busy.
One of my favorite breakfast places to eat the people are always nice in the red chili is delicious and hot
Best breakfast. The waitress was very good. She was very helpful to a half breed who doesnt speak any Spanish at all

Amazing atmosphere and quintessentially New Mexico. This place is an Albuquerque mainstay and a cultural gem. The food is not the fanciest and not a 10 but the heritage and history of the restaurant makes it a 10+.
Friendly neighborhood restaurant. Excellent food. Workers are friendly especially the cashier Geri.
Quaint breakfast and lunch spot with delicious comfort food. If you want to taste authentic New Mexico cuisine, eat here.
I got food poisoning from here on that day. I would give them negative stars. Bad experience. I was vomiting and had diahrea for nearly two 1/2 days.

Cool atmosphere, good selection of local food, and good customer service. The food is a little expensive, but worth the price typically. I would give a 5 start review to the bartender, Brian I believe, who was an absolute beast! He picked up where his counterparts feel short in service. 
Definitely go... Form your own opinion.

I cant think of one thing I would recommend differently with this place. The atmosphere was incredible! The people were friendly and fun to talk with. This place would be fun just to read all the pictures of past visitors from so many icons such as Presidents, politicians and singers. Food is like no other Mexican food you have ever had. I promise you that this place will leave you recommending many people to visit.

Fantastic atmosphere and the best margaritas I have ever had.  They actually asked how we wanted them made and based the tequila choice on that.   I prefer tart vs sweet which you don't find very often.  This was one the money!    The food was wonderful as well!

This place was delicious! The food was great and the service was A+. I had a chicken burrito and definitely going with the red and green sauce on it experience both. The major stand out dish was the fried green chilies..... Unbelievable how good they were.

Excellent New Mexican restaurant which caters to both locals and tourists. The mild Chile is very mild, and I ordered Christmas and can attest this is true of both the red and green. The hot is the usual spice level  for this region.  Casual, excellent service, with indoor and patio seating. The place is huge, but broken up into smaller rooms with a nice homey feel.

Great restaurant all the servers work together to make sure everyone is satisfied with everything...... And have visited both locations and they both work the same. And great food at both restaurants also. We will  definitely be back.
This restaurant has some of the fastest and most efficient service I've ever experienced! Also, the food I got was almost perfect in every single way. I'm definitely coming back here again!

Loved the food. This place isn’t fancy, lots of locals eating there. The service was friendly. We enjoyed the salsa—-nice and spicy! There is only one type of margarita: made with agave wine. It was different, but we liked it. Vegetarian options were available. I love my Chiles Rellenos and Tamales and this little hole in the wall did not disappoint!! If I were living in Albuquerque, this would be the only place I’d go for Mexican food!! It is a cut above a run down Mom and Pop operation but well maintained and the service was excellent. Easy on the wallet too. Dive in, dive in, dive some more..
Humble abode for incredibly authentic Mexican fare. I had the Miguel's Burrito special and it blew me away! Chips and salsa are exceptional and prices aren't bad. What a gem!

I like this place so much! The taste of this restaurant is excellent, I am so glad to stop by here all the way from Phoenix. The building is quite old but it makes me feeling cozy and comfortable. I like Mexican foods and visited many Mexican restaurants and this is one of the the best Mexican restaurant ever! I am sure I will be there again.

So good but the Green Chile could be a little hotter 😉 I get the combo c or the combo D with extra green Chile and no cheese and just regular fries... Lol I like to be able to feel my tongue somewhat after I'm done eating the tacos and the Chile fries would be next level for sure.. one of my favorite places to go for sure when I'm craving something spicy.

Bob's burgers is a great New Mexican diner. Their green and red Chile sauce are what separate them from most other restaurants, as it is both of great quality and price. The service is always friendly and they have a variety of daily deals that are predictable. They have taco Tuesday, although for them it is Taco burger Tuesday. Their Taco Burgers are stellar in my opinion. Their Chile has a but of a bite if you aren't used to it.
Good place to go for a quick munchy fix. It is a typical fast food place but with a slight twist. I do like their taco burgers otherwise the burgers seem pretty much standard fare.
Casual restaurant serving decent burgers with delicious green chile sauce. Meals come at a pretty good value. Guests who don't like spicy food should ask for the sauce to be served on the side.

This is the dirtiest, scummiest fast food joint I've ever been in,if there were a negative scale I'd hit the -5 stars, I shouldn't have stayed, but the food was ordered by the time I made it to the mensroom.
There should be a law! The urinal flooded, the sink was rotted out and there was no hand soap, so what were the workers doing about hygiene?  Nothing I'd guess, if you're planning to eat here get a ptomane shot at least....in the meantime try licking the next toilet seat you find, that way you'll get an idea of how I've been feeling since eating there....

Cafe styled eatery next to U of New Mexico campus. Well-staffed and efficient.  Has a lot of New Mexico styled favorites on the menu. I had a chicken enchilada topped with green chili stew. It was delicious. It would have been nice to be able to have a beer with that enchilada.

My family loves the frontier! You always get great food for a great price. The clientele is not always the best as homeless people meander through the restaurant on occasion. The Frontier is one of Albuquerque's shining stars. We've been going here for over 30 years.

I came for the famed sweet rolls and was not disappointed. My sweet roll was buttery and delicious. We parked in a lot behind the restaurant that advertised free parking for the first 45 minutes. We arrived in the early afternoon on a Thursday and the restaurant was not busy at all. We were able to order our food, eat, and get back to the car with time to spare. Given the huge number of tables here and the signs warning of wait times, it looks like this place can get swamped with people during busy times.
Very cool place. Good food & good sized portions. The place is huge & so interesting. Serves an eclectic crowd, for sure. Hardly a wait at all, which was great. Definitely worth the trip.

The food never disappoints. They messed up on a couple peoples food though. They didn't put beans on it. Other then that, it was good. We met the owner and she was nice. She put us to the front of the line because there was a group of people. We weren't a part of the group. I always get the 1/2 enchilada plate. That's the right portion for me. I get it without onions and green chile. They have the new lemonade with sprite there too. All it taste like is fizzy lemonade. If u haven't tried this place, its a must. Its that yummy 😋
The best thing on the menu is there shredded beef tacos. I definitely rate them about a three on there other food. Their tacos  Are definitely one of the best in town
Tamale's tasted like they microwaved.  I asked for no carnish and got a ton. Definitely won't go back to the one on Coors next to home Depot.

I've  eaten here a handful of times and have always had a good experience. Food is tasty and workers are helpful. Ordered the 6 pack of tacos for 2 of us to share and it was perfectly portioned with meat and garnish. Not bad pricing either. I recommend giving this place a try. If you've read my review please hit the like button. Thank you.
Delicious as always. They are always so generous with the cheese they put it on everything!
It was my first time there and it was great I'm definitely going back for more

If your looking for a nostalgic experience on Historic Route 66 then this is the right place for you. After reading the reviews we were a little worried since we were already seated, but we were extremely pleased once our waitress and soda jerk, Dawn, came to wait on us. She did an amazing job. She was very pleasant and full of energy. We ordered cheeseburgers and hot dogs. The burgers we ordered were cooked exactly to order and the Hebrew National hot dogs were amazing. We also ordered Homemade Root Beer Float and the Chocolate Malt which also were very good. If your looking for some good food, good atmosphere, and excellent service then stop in and see Dawn and the crew here.

When you walk in its so cute. I loved the decor. First thought "bet their food is bomb".  Boy was i wrong. First no combos available. Frys are seperate at 5.00 a pop. They looked like string beans no seasoning at all. I ordered two 9.00 burgers well done.. both came to the table pink. The staff was to busy chatting to attend to our needs. I asked for a knife 3 times. Never will return ..no wonder it was empty
The malts were great, but the service and the food were not.
Love eating here, the burgers are awesome and the homemade soup rocks my sock.

This has to be the worst place in Albuquerque the prices are high the food is one step up from dog food if that I wacth them falsely accusing a man of having a fake hundred dollar bill and called the police when the police got there turns out the hundred dollar bill was real and they didn't even offer an apology maybe it's just because he was black

I Love Saggios Pizza! They have the best toppings. The Pepperoni, Green Chile, and Italian Sausage is my favorite! A little pricy, but very delicious.
🌟🌟🌟🌟

The NY pies are golden! Honestly the best Pizza I have had in New Mexico (NY Native). I haven’t tried anything else so this rating is exclusively for their N.Y. style pizza pies! Amazing, they get everything right. Very filling, a little pricey but I think it’s worth it!
So good and not just the pizza!!!! Salmon is very yummy and my daughter loved the pasta. Great before popejoy and love that you accept pocket points!
Great food and atmosphere. The staff are super friendly despite how busy they always are. First time there, won't be the last.
Loved since Nunzio's. Hadn't been to Saggios in a while. Pepperoni/green chili pizza was very good; comfortable atmosphere. Nice experience.

An amazing place with amazingly tasty food. If one wants to have the tastiest food, this is the right place. They serve the food in a very creative manner and treat you in a very good way. The place is worth a visit. It is a delightfully delicious place to eat. Everybody at this place was so happy and it was all a joyous evening.

When we went, it was not busy. Parking was abundant. Everything was great. The location , the service and the food. It is easily one of the BEST restaurants in Albuquerque and worth every penny. That being said, in fairness, sometimes they fall short of the bar, but this only seems to be the case when going in during odd hours. It shouldn't happen, but it does, sometimes.

Great barbecue, and decent options for the little ones. This place can get busy and sometimes the wait time can be long. When it gets busy it can feel cramped and makes you feel like you need to step out the cabin for a sec for fresh air.

The BBQ is good. The special bread is amazing, and the prices aren't too bad. The salad and the regular bread are not so great, though. If you can get a window seat, you will have a nice view of the city, too.

The County Line is a long time Albuquerque favorite for BBQ. I have been here many times, always had a good meal & good experience. The south part of the dining area has very large windows & a great view of the city - try to request a seat in this area if possible. Often very busy on weekends so there may be a moderate wait during dinner hours. But it will be worth it! I highly recommend County Line BBQ; everything here -- food, service, views, etc. is just good.

This place has a large variety of specialty pizzas that are actually executed. As long as some local craft beer and wine. If you're into that kind of thing with your pizza. They have an excellent pizza and salad pairing that reduce is the calorie count to something reasonable.

Quite prompt
Had the pasta alfredo.  Rich and tasty.  Gluten free  pizzas  are a  must for my wife. She loved it  .a generous glass of wine and a  complete  pleasure for dinner  out.

I went with a friend after a show at it was wonderful.  The main reason we chose this restaurant is because it was almost 10 pm and some of the others we might have chosen were closed, and it really wasnt a waffle house type meal we wanted.
We ordered the white pizza and the house salad.  It was excellent.  The place was almost empty when we got there a bit before 10, with the restaurant closing at 11.  The staff was gracious and welcoming even though by the time our pizza arrived we were the only customers in the place.  No one hurried us or gave any of medication that they were clock watch, although who could really blame them if they had.  We did leave before 11, the stated closing time because it would have been rude not to
The food was excellent and so was the staff.  The price was very reasonable and it was a perfect ending to a delightful evening

Some of the best pizza I've had in a long time. 10/10 would recommend to any pizza lover looking to try something new and get a different taste. A large assortment of toppings and a helpful kind staff makes this one of my favorite places to get pizza.
Always delicious and carefully made food. Always great service. Love sitting in the patio all year round!

The most immersive experience I've ever had in a restaurant. My first time having Turkish coffee as well as a genuine Turkish delight to compliment. Honestly couldn't have ever been better. Still floating. I was not expecting there to be so much food on the plate. 2 people can share an entree with leftovers and with a decent appetizer 3 people could share an entree easily. I will be returning and this will be where my wife and I will be coming for our anniversary dinner.

Love this restaurant. Each day for lunch they have special. Friday's and weekends nights they have belly dancing. Staff is very helpful when you have questions. Vegetarian options are available and delicious.

I really like this restaurant, they have an amazing atmosphere and even better food. I have only been here a hand full of time for both lunch and dinner but I have had a great experience every time I've been. They have huge portions, friendly staff, and I haven't tried a dish I haven't liked yet.

First time I've ever been to this place it was not too bad. I have the shank lamb and it was pretty good but there was a lot of fat on it. there was a rice I can't remember what they called it but it was very very good. There was about six of us at the table and everyone seemed to enjoy their meals. I will try it again. Service was very good
Food is good. Prices are retarded. Owner is rude.

Great food, hostess was gorgeous and very nice. This place is for the milder curry lovers and great if you are bringing people to try Indian for the first time. However....my truck got booted and the ransom was 60 bucks. Note...DO NO PARK ON THE MCDONALD'S SIDE OF THE RESTAURANT.

The atmosphere is beautiful.  We loved the sauces, rice, and naan but the chicken and lamb were too tough and didn't taste very good.  They were short-staffed the night we went but our waitress was nice.

The standard Indian fare can be found here, with some very tasty additions.  I was very impressed with the coconut tomato soup - I'll definitely be coming back for more!  The thalis are large, but not quite as diverse as one can find elsewhere.

Great buffet style Indian restaurant. Loved the vegetarian options. The chicken curry was a little sweet, but you get fresh naan delivered to your table and masala tea on the buffet as well. I will definitely be back here! The atmosphere is cozy and inviting; the chairs are great! It's like being in a friend's living room. A must for lunch. :)

Just went their to lunch today. It was a buffet for 10$ (tip+tax included) and I have to say the food was just delicious. Definitely the best Indian restaurant I ever tried in Abq. Everything was so tasteful and there was a great variety of vegetarian food (even if the best was the chicken). Service was very good; but I gotta say for a buffet you dont expect much. Our waitress was so nice, she came to ask several times if everything was fine and even gave us a bunch of naan bread to eat later on the day.

Recommended 100% 

Did not go for dinner yet, so no idea about the menu/price/service, but the lunch was so good that I'm sure you can find amazingly good tasting food.

Okay this is one of those little tiny hipster restaurants that's actually worth the hype. The food is excellent.
they have an upstairs area that we didn't get to see that's apparently a wine bar some days or evenings at the week. I would definitely go visit if I'm in the area again.

I'm not one for leaving reviews unless service is REALLY bad or REALLY good (I should probably take more time to do so).  My wife and I were told about Slate Street Cafe and we weren't disappointed.  We went there with our best friends and couldn't have had a better time.  I'm VERY picky about food and the burger I had there was the best burger I've ever had; I wish I remembered which one so I could have it again when I go back.  Great food.  Great service.  Polite staff.  We'll be back!  Updated 2/10/19: My wife and I went back again this past week and were surprised to find only a few other people in the restaurant!  Had the Slate Street Burger again--so did my wife--and it was just what I remembered it to be!  THE BEST BURGER IN TOWN (but you have to get it with ALL of the extras)!  This cafe has a ritzy, high-end vibe, but prices are very down-to-earth.
Amazing place, great service. I love the place and the menu. Th staff were friendly and accommodated. They even offer free coffee to go. Great experience.

I love Slate Street.  They only have OK vegetarian options, but I love their appetizers and we usually just fill up on a few of those and dessert.  

I would suggest the mushroom fries and the baked goat cheese!

Great selection of wine, as well.
Had brunch there recently as a birthday get together for my daughter. Sausage biscuits and gravy, both were very dry. Hash browns were good. Others enjoyed their meals.

They Lie to me NO Vegan Option & Waiting  There for Nothing waste of time at the Table. I Did NOT Like What Was on The Menu & it was Disgusting. So I left quick. I Did not want to be Seen There Either. Because I'm kinda famous. Definitely Not My Type Of Place.

I am vegan and one of my friends who went with me eats halal (my friend enjoyed the lamb). We loved the food and the experience so much that we came back the next night also. The staff and owners are very nice. Next time I am back in Albuquerque I will eat here again.

My favorite Indian food lunch buffet here in Albuquerque.  We make it a point to go meet at least once a month with our friends.  They have all the great stuff you'd expect at a Indian food buffet and they do a great job at all of it.  It's typically bustling and busy at lunch, but with several dining areas and attentive polite staff that are constantly on top of everything, it's always a pleasurable experience.

First time coming here, and first time eating Indian food, and I have to say that I loved it! The location is pretty old and might be in need for an update, but they make up for it with the great food. I went for lunch, and they have their buffet, which makes it really easy to get a sample of their offerings
Always wonderful!  Have been a patron for years, and it's always a good bet.  Had the baked eggplant and lamb meatballs.....great!  Always have an appetizer.
Thai tip has some of the city's best Thai food. I love it.  Everything is freshly made and you can taste it. The place is small and also always busy.

Got there at 11:30, didn't get food until 1. The waitress was obviously annoyed at being busy and let it show to who she was serving. Apparently people should know that if it's possible for it to be busy, that they shouldn't go at all because it'll be a long wait, according to the same waitress. What I got wasn't what I ordered, it was cold, and it didn't taste very good. The rice in my friends food was way undercooked and hard to eat. I understand when places get busy, but an hour and a half is just ridiculous, with no help from the wait staff. I got one water refill the whole time I was there. Overall, bad experience.

Good food, good service, good prices. Have been here for dinner a few times and it's always good. I hear they do a busy lunch business as well. We've always been able to get a table right away or after a less than 5-minute wait. There's a lot of take-out for dinner, so you may want to try that if you don't want a sit-down meal. Not sure how they prepare the tofu, but it's the best I've ever had.
Nice selection, no lunch specials tho. Some of the hottest NM hot or Thai hot options around! Medium is enjoyable and plenty of heat for most.

Great food, but I had to wait over 1 hour for my food on a Monday evening. Maybe they should hire more kitchen staff? Door Dash to-go orders were flying out the door, but everyone in dining room was waiting forever for their food.

Took our whole wedding party up the tram. Had our wedding on the deck followed by the reception in High Finance. Great service, the food was good, and the drinks are high altitude. I recommend them for weddings, make sure you book when the weather is good.  Decent price.

First you don't really go to the top of the crest to get a good meal,  but there is no reason why you shouldn't get one. I ordered a split duck breast since the 2 of us were not very hungry. We ordered tea only to find that the little box they presented the tea bags in was next to barren, had to have like an apple spice tea while looking for a green tea. How could waitresses and management just let this slip by? The answer? They don't care. I ordered mushroom soup and it came with the meal instead of being served earlier while the meal was cooking. I sent the soup back since I didn't want to choose which I was going to let get cold. The waitress was well versed at apologizing but didn't seem to understand what service meant. she never offered more water for tea or for drinking. The duck arrived and it was only half cooked, I don't know if you've ever eaten partially cooked fowl but it was not delectable. The dessert was typical factory built frozen fare.
My suggestion, enjoy the tram ride, get a soup or salad and enjoy the views.

View is great if course. Service was friendly and efficient. Food was surprisingly good. I'm not sure why I was afraid it wouldn't be. My husband and I both had the Kobe burgers that were tasty and cooked to order. My kids had the fish tacos and a grilled cheese. Again, all good. The menu was somewhat limited but I assume it's a chore as is getting things to the restaurant, on top of a mountain.

The bacon wrapped pork sirloin had a great flavor. The carrot cake was also very good.
The main course in my opinion should have been much larger than 6.5 oz for the price.
The server and manager were very nice and accommodating. With the taste of the meal I'd have loved to rate it higher but the portion size took away from the meal. 
To add to the night,  my credit card was lost for a while.
Also found out the place is to be torn down and replaced this month. Closed for more than a year.

I had a reunion with my friend that I attended a police academy with 35 years ago.  I told him how impressive not just the view was, but the dining experience being unparalleled.  He was not disappointed.  The meal was shear perfection.  The wine selections were "World Class", as well as the staff that offered optimum in Customer Service and attention to our every individual needs.  This was my second experience and it is with the greatest anticipation, I can visit again, soonest!  

The Reid Family really loves this place, and the folks that operate it!

I admit to eating here as much as possible in the evenings, but I was really excited about their new Italian menu as well as new lunch offerings. My friends and I each ordered a different pizza and were BLOWN away by all three, which we traded for taste testing. top notch handmade pies each with a distinct flavor and style. We will definitively be coming back for lunch again!!!
Eberything was great. Will be back!!!!!
Nice

Looked on line for a wine bar and Zinc was perfect. Heather was awesome. Had the Flank steak and the Cabernet that Heather suggested. Both were great.
It's a very cool place. Will be back in April.
Thanks gang.
Awesome food, wine, service. We ate at the chef bar. Our steaks were perfect. There will definitely be another visit next time I am in town. Don't forget to drop in in the Seller bar downstairs.
It was fantastic. The food the atmosphere, the service was top notch, it was all first rate. I can't recommend it enough.

Great for hosting a special event. Zinc holds special events before they open during the day. I recently hosted a baby shower here. The staff was quick to respond, accommodating and friendly throughout the planning of the event. The day of the shower everything was set up lovely before we arrived. The ambiance is great in there! People remarked on how delicious the food was and the service was outstanding. I would highly recommend hosting a special event here.
Cool underground spot. Cozy. Decent eats. A little pricey. Nice place to hug up with Ms. Right or Ms. Right now👍

Love this place.  They have a great selection of fresh produce, plus plenty of other organic & non-gmo foods.  The staff has always been helpful in finding what I need.  They often have sales too! Yes, many products are more expensive than traditional foods, but I expect to pay a little more for quality.

Warning! Most of the staff are unhelpful, rude, and inconsiderate which made this an unpleasant shopping trip. The store itself is rather small, dimly lit, unorganized, and dirty. The only redeeming quality of this co-op store is that they offer bulk liquids, loose spices, and local produce. Unfortunately, the bulk items were dirty with handprints, messy floor spills and dripping liquids which makes you consider if the bulk selection is worth it for all the potential germs. Poor customer service and unimpressive store.

If you like being waited on by rude, smug, self satisfied, PC yuppies and paying $2.50 for one donut!!!, you will love this place. I wish I could give them 0 stars because I hate this store. Prices are truly a rip off. Having lived in San Francisco, New York, and Hawaii, I know a good co op from a bad one, and this one fails on every level. The Walmart in the war zone is preferable to this place. Ignore all the fake reviews (that were probably placed by co op staff).
Constiantly great produce, hot food bar and sandwiches. The service is always great and very helpful I love shopping here... And I'm an owner hahaha

Went in yesterday morning Sunday March 11 2019 me and my friend were treated terribly by the lady cashier who was rude as hell and mean. I almost expected her to say what do I want  when I went to pay for my groceries.               thx montanita for reminding me why I don’t come here that will be the last time Ever set foot or my friend in such a rude over expensive racially charged place

got to watch them close to actually give you a advertised price at checkout, cozy, fairly clean, but usually the checkout conveyor is dirty, sticky and uncared for-- it grosses me out!!! other than that it is reasonably good. Update i see they have armed the cashiers with spray cleaner and wipes and are keeping the checkout conveyor clean, she told me they have been instructed to routinely clean the conveyor, kudos to sprout corporate for their response to my review, keep up the great work!!

I went to the Lomas Sprouts Saturday. For the second time I was grabbed and manhandled by a customer. Not blaming Sprouts for that, but they also do nothing about it. I also noticed someone eating out of the raw nuts bins, complete with his hands. When I said something to an employee, was told, oh well. Oh gross! The final straw was during checkout with Lillian D. No greeting (fine, I was sick) but had an incredibly snotty attitude with me. When I went to pay, I used the card for the account I do not keep money in, until its time to pay bills. What was her response when it was declined? In a loud voice she said, "insufficients funds". I will never go back, which is a shame because I did like their prices and selection.

Good customer service,  produce and prices. Has that local neighborhood feel.
Alas, ALWAYS check your final tally at the check out. 9 times out of 10 the clerks incorrectly ring up your bill: 3 items rather than the two you purchased; omit the sale price for the day; etc. No problems though,  they always honor & refund the mistakes even if you get home and discover the error(s).  Just a bit annoying. 😯
The best produce. Very knowledgeable staff when it comes to product. Hands down the best grocery store to shop at. I love Sprouts.
Pretty good location. Sometimes their inventory fluxuates, which can be annoying, but overall good.

got to watch them close to actually give you a advertised price at checkout, cozy, fairly clean, but usually the checkout conveyor is dirty, sticky and uncared for-- it grosses me out!!! other than that it is reasonably good. Update i see they have armed the cashiers with spray cleaner and wipes and are keeping the checkout conveyor clean, she told me they have been instructed to routinely clean the conveyor, kudos to sprout corporate for their response to my review, keep up the great work!!

I also noticed someone eating out of the raw nuts bins, complete with his hands. When I said something to an employee, was told, oh well. Oh gross! The final straw was during checkout with Lillian D. No greeting (fine, I was sick) but had an incredibly snotty attitude with me. When I went to pay, I used the card for the account I do not keep money in, until its time to pay bills. What was her response when it was declined? In a loud voice she said, "insufficients funds". I will never go back, which is a shame because I did like their prices and selection.

Alas, ALWAYS check your final tally at the check out. 9 times out of 10 the clerks incorrectly ring up your bill: 3 items rather than the two you purchased; omit the sale price for the day; etc. No problems though,  they always honor & refund the mistakes even if you get home and discover the error(s).  Just a bit annoying. 😯
The best produce. Very knowledgeable staff when it comes to product. Hands down the best grocery store to shop at. I love Sprouts.
Pretty good location. Sometimes their inventory fluxuates, which can be annoying, but overall good.

I love everything about the store especially the frozen foods. They're healthy, easy to prepare and reasonably priced. During the work days, I pick something up with maybe a salad or a loaf of bread for an easy to prepare meal for my family. What's great is that there's a good selection of frozen ethnic foods! We're always trying something new. Meal times are exciting!

This is a great place to buy groceries. Some of the health food grocery stores have a terrible reputation about being overpriced and having a strange and rare selection. Trader Joe's has a beautiful basic medium roast coffee that's $5 a pound. You can buy wine there at a very reasonable price and you can buy by the case. The produce section is amazing and comparable with everyone else's prices. If you like cheese this is the one place in the city to go to. They have some beautiful rare cave aged Swiss cheese and it's really good. they have five kinds of cheese there that you might have trouble pronouncing their names. It's an amazing selection. And on a strange aesthetic side point some of the most handsome men in the city seem to work there all the time. It's easy on the eyes and very friendly.

I love Trader Joe's! I think it's more affordable than Whole Foods. I don't think there is nothing not to like about it. I bought a bunch of wine when I was there mostly for cooking. You can't beat the two buck chuck though it's not that anymore. Still the price is good.

I moved from NYC 5 months ago and my Trader Joe's experience has changed tremendously. When I go the staff is delightful. Whenever I can't find an item either they get it for me or when they run out they let me know what days the product might be coming in. I've been getting consistent wonderful customer service since I started coming to this location. you won't regret coming in.

Even though its extremely hard to find a decent supply chain for vegan organic food, they actually do a decent job at it! I find great deals on organic produce like bagged organic apples and potatoes when I'm there. Sometimes they're a bit bruised but I use them for juicing and for the price that is acceptable. Basically they just buy up unsaleable lots from other health food stores and resell them. Kind of an outlet mall for natural foods. One thing I disapprove of.. is there's an obnoxiously large liquor department taking up half the store. And everything being packaged does add an element of wastefulness, it would be nice to see a bulk bins section. The cashiers are above and beyond friendly and helpful though and the atmosphere and location of the store are both ideal. Overall they are one of the best options in town!

I love everything about the store especially the frozen foods. They're healthy, easy to prepare and reasonably priced. During the work days, I pick something up with maybe a salad or a loaf of bread for an easy to prepare meal for my family. What's great is that there's a good selection of frozen ethnic foods! We're always trying something new. Meal times are exciting!

And on a strange aesthetic side point some of the most handsome men in the city seem to work there all the time. It's easy on the eyes and very friendly.

I've been getting consistent wonderful customer service since I started coming to this location. you won't regret coming in.

I find great deals on organic produce like bagged organic apples and potatoes when I'm there. Sometimes they're a bit bruised but I use them for juicing and for the price that is acceptable. Basically they just buy up unsaleable lots from other health food stores and resell them. Kind of an outlet mall for natural foods. One thing I disapprove of.. is there's an obnoxiously large liquor department taking up half the store. And everything being packaged does add an element of wastefulness, it would be nice to see a bulk bins section. The cashiers are above and beyond friendly and helpful though and the atmosphere and location of the store are both ideal. Overall they are one of the best options in town!

Whole Foods always has good customer service the employees are always willing to answer any questions you have. Yesterday I was at the one at Carlisle I could actually make a day of it. They have so much to choose from and their deli are definitely to die for. The only one thing is I wish the prices were a little lower. The bakery is also very good. 👍👍👍🤔and the thought full sign is hoping they will drop their prices a bit.

Stopped here while traveling to visit family. Bought from the salad bar and the best organic cherry tomatoes for my son. Very nice store and was busy. Surprised by the mention of Amazon prime memberships at the register when paying them

The quality of food here is plummeting. I have found dirt in my ground beef twice now: two weeks in a row. Recently we found plastic in the clam chowder. Its not really what I would expect from Whole foods. I would like to continue shopping here but I am a little worried.

I only come here for the unhealthy food or when I really want some good meat or cheese. I don't give a hoot about the healthy organic all natural buzzword food. Personally, it's overrated, overpriced, and not worth it. But that bakery? I will eat all 1000 calories of that tiny little cake. No regrets. 
Good selection of cheese, great place for fresh meat and local coffee. 

Also, there seems to be bar soap everywhere. Really.. it seemed every 2-3 aisles there was a display for some sort of soap. So much so that I'm beginning to think that this Whole Foods location is trying to tell us we smell bad. Well jokes on you Whole Foods! I showered at least twice since I last visited 3 months ago! 

Generally very friendly staff though! Even if they think we smell bad..
Can I get a smile from anyone in this place? Healthy living what about been good to one another.  $ changes people.  #compassion #bekind #smile
